column5: March 2 is a year that my mom passed away.  Many of you know how close I was to her and this week has been a very emotional week filled with tears. Friday the 2nd is going to be very hard for myself and family.  If you could just give a quick thought to a great lady, best friend, Nan, wife and mother.  She is sadly missed and treasured by all of us.      Thanks Blake
Sure thing Blake.  She'll always live on as long you keep honouring her memory.  See ya at the show man.  Charles
Not a problem!  You and your family will be in our thoughts tomorrow.  Cliff and Carole (bly)
No problem Blake, my thoughts are with you and your family.  How bout a nice picture of her in your post!!  Joey
When ever you need one Blake, as long as you never forget her..all will be fine!   .....my father's "with me" every day...I know your thoughts and I've had them for 21 years come next month.
I know exactly what your talking about Blake.      I pay homage to my father who died of cancer (esophagus) every june 6th.  My prayers are with you, Remember the good times dude..Cheers, sturgman
Hi Blake,  I do recall this event in your life last year and you are in our thoughts and heart in this family.  Best regards, Sam , Laurie and kids
You'll be in our thoughts today Blake.
Tears are Ok Blake, just try to mix a few smiles in there too; remember some of the good times!  She will be in your heart forever!
You got it Blake, consider it done
While death removes the body from this earth it grants immortality to the spirit. So celebrate the spirit and it everlasting life.  Art
Try not to think of what you lost, but all that you gained. Life is different now that's she's gone, but with her life, yours is blessed.
Blake, I know what you're feeling, I lost my Dad 3 1/2 years ago...I still miss him everyday, the grief gets easier, but never goes away.
of course... Such a person certainly deserves a moment in time to be remembered by all, including those who did not know her... My thoughts are with you, your family and your mother.

Blake my thoughts are with ya bud. I lost my mom 7 years ago in Feb. I know what you are going through. Keep the good thoughts and it is only human to cry. Don't let anyone else tell you otherwise. Cheers AL
My thoughts are with you and your family and remember nobody dies as long as you keep them in your heart and memories.
I lost my Mom in 2004 and my Dad in 2005 - both to cancer.  I still miss them both; however, it does get easier.  I think Express168 said it best above.
Good reminder!!  Ill think of you.. Ive lost my mom as well.. always a hole there now..
we will be thinking of her blake take it easy Mike
